description: From Middle English overdon, from Old English oferdōn, equivalent to over- +‎ do.

verbs.description: overdo (third-person singular simple present overdoes, present participle overdoing, simple past overdid, past participle overdone)

entries.meaning: To do too much; to exceed what is proper or true in doing; to carry too far.
examples: I overdid the sweets during the holidays and put on some weight.

entries.meaning: To give (someone or something) too much work; to require too much effort or strength of (someone); to use up too much of (something).
examples: Synonyms: overtask, overtax, fatigue, exhaust, wear out

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To do more than (someone); to do (something) to a greater extent.
